text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5e9031e6caa4850004ae2833|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-26" to "anthony-isabella"
name: anthony-isabella

text:
Hey Isabella, please meet Anthony your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:.Â Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or penny-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Note: You will not see your match as a "member" in this channel however you can see from the chat history that they have joined/been added :smile:

Hi there :slightly_smiling_face:
I've no clue what they told you about me so I'm gonna introduce myself, sorry if you already know part of this.
My name is Anthony Arnoux, I graduated from the French school Supinfocom in 2008 and moved to London right after where I've been (mostly) living and working since then.
I started as a freelancer in the commercial industry, initially as a generalist with a focus on lighting and rendering and ended up doing mostly lighting/rendering for close to 6 years.
I then looked for new challenges and ended up picking up Houdini which naturally lead me to the FX world, I never looked back since.
For the past 5 or 6 years I've been working in the movie industry with the last 3 as a Senior FX/TD at ILM London. I'm now at Framestore London, in the IA branch (formerly named Commercials). My initial plan was to switch back to the movies branch in June/July but with this pandemic that I'm sure you've heard of, schedules are slightly affected and the position I was eyeballing will probably not be available anymore. We'll see.
I have a showreel if you're curious, happy to share if you want to see it.
I'm working remotely for the past 3 weeks and try to always keep an eye on slack/emails and all, feel free to reach anytime you need or want.

That's for me, if you have any question, please shout :slightly_smiling_face:
Ho also, full disclosure: first time mentoring for me! though I've worked with numerous juniors through my career, that's what led me to sign up for this mentoring program.
